text: Samuel Simco Gason (2 June 1845, Adelaide–11 Apr 1897, Gibsons Camp) was an early settler of the Flinders Ranges described as having had a colourful contribution to early South Australian history. Mount Gason on the Northern Territory/South Australian Border is named after him. ==References== Category:Settlers of Australia Category:1845 births Category:1897 deaths
title: Samuel Gason
